alert.note: Alert for Sheridan; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 8:26PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Cherry and northern Sheridan Counties through 800 PM MDT... At 725 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rushville, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gordon, Rushville, Clinton, Hoover Lake, Lone Butte, Irwin, Intersection of Highway 20 and Irwin Road, Shell Lake State Wildlife Management Area, Bayonne and Intersection of Highway 27 and Mills Road. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 80 and 125. Highway 250 between mile markers 40 and 48. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
